IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: The Organization's mission is to support healthcare education, research and patient care programs in the State of New Jersey and for other scientific, charitable, literary and educational purposes.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The Organization's mission is to support healthcare education, research and patient care programs in the State of New Jersey and for other scientific, charitable, literary and educational purposes.
IRS990.Desc: The organization provided grants to support faculty chairs, research scholarships, fellowships and other programs at Rutgers School of Biomedical and Health Sciences and Rowan School or Osteopathic Medicine in accordance with donor restrictions

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: The organization provided grants to the faculty of Rutgers School of Biomedical Health Sciences, New Jersey Institute of Technology, Princeton University, Stevens Institute of Technology, Kessler Foundation, Cooper University Healthcare, Hackensack Meridian Health and Rowan School of Osteopathic Medicine to help further research in a wide variety of medical and scientific areas.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Payments to charitable gift annuitant holders.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization has an escrow held with a bank related to a transaction with an investee company. The balance belongs to NJHF to be used for any expenses incurred by NJHF related to its role as shareholder representation in the transaction.

The intended uses for the endowment funds are determined by the underlying endowment agreements entered into by and between the specific donor and NJHF. The uses include, but are not limited to, faculty chairs, research, lectureships, and scholarships and fellowships.

New Jersey Health Foundation files a tax return in the U.S. federal jurisdiction and is registered as a charity in NJ. The foundation has no unrecognized tax liabilities or uncertain tax positions at June 30, 2023. The Organization did not have any tax related interest or penalties for the periods reported in the consolidated financial statements as of and for the years ended June 30, 2023 and 2022.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: Grants to support researchers early stage innovative ideas.
Grants to support researchers' early stage innovative ideas.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: Edward J Ill Excellence in Medicine Foundation

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: Grant to organization to support scholarship program

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Grants are awarded to NJHF affiliated organizations to support specific research and technology subject to grant submission and approval by a committee of the board of directors. Investment income from permanently restricted endowed funds are used in accordance with the donors intent. Award letters are sent to the university specifying the amount of the grant, specific department and purpose of the grant. For NJHF research grants, final programmatic and financial reports are submitted detailing the use of the funding and the research completed.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The sole member of New Jersey Health Foundation is Foundation for Health Advancement.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Foundation for Health Advancement elects/appoints the board members of the governing body of New Jersey Health Foundation.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The annual budget of New Jersey Health Foundation (NJHF) requires approval of the Member. In addition, the NJHF shall not encumber any assets/make distributions of assets without the consent of the Member.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Form 990 is compiled by the VP of Finance with the assistance of the VP of HR and Administration. The completed draft return is sent to an outside tax professional who reviews the return. The completed return is then reviewed by the CEO and President. Any modifications to the return based on those reviews are made. The Finance Committee reviews the return and provides any comments and recommendations. The 990 is finalized and sent to the full board of directors prior to submission.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: All officers and directors must complete a conflict of interest questionnaire on an annual basis. In addition, all individuals completing the questionnaire acknowledge by signature that they agree to comply with the conflict of interest policy and will update the information provided in the event of any material change.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The compensation committee consisting of the Vice Chair, Chair and Secretary of the Board of Directors of NJHF meet annually to review and approve the compensation of the president and officer of the organization. The process includes review and approval by the compensation committee through the use of comparable compensation information, contemporaneous documentation and recordkeeping.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The governing documents, conflict of interest policy and financial statements of the organization are available upon request.

IdRelatedTaxExemptOrgGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: Support research at affiliated organizations through Innovation Grant Program and related activities
